RFL.question: Define the term 'Code 4'
RFL.answer: Request Wants and Warrants - Used to obtain a background check on a specific person or vehicle.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN CODES FOR RADIO COMMUNICATIONS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.9

RFL.question: Define the term 'Code 12'
RFL.answer: Duress - Refers to any duress situation.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN CODES FOR RADIO COMMUNICATIONS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.9

RFL.question: Define the term 'Code 16'
RFL.answer: Alarm Activation - Used to initiate an alarm activation.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN CODES FOR RADIO COMMUNICATIONS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.9

RFL.question: Define an Active Duress
RFL.answer: Active duress may be indicated by the use of electronic duress alarms to covertly advise another location/unit of a duress situation. Without alerting the person(s) causing the duress, that the alarm has been sounded. Other examples of active duress indicators include the passing of the wing duress word or failing to properly authenticate via the authentication code.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

RFL.question: Define a Passive Duress
RFL.answer: Passive Duress. Passive duress is three consecutive failures to respond to your radio call sign.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

RFL.question: What is the alternate channel used when notified of a Code 9?
RFL.answer: A Net - Channel 3
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

RFL.question: Under what jurisdiction does PSFB operate?
RFL.answer: Exclusive
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN LEGAL CONSIDERATIONS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 3 Para 3.1-Para 3.3

RFL.question: Under what jurisdiction does CCSFS operate?
RFL.answer: Exclusive and proprietary
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN LEGAL CONSIDERATIONS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 3 Para 3.1-Para 3.3

RFL.question: To what document would you refer to for specific jurisdictional boundaries.
RFL.answer: SLD 45 Integrated Defense Plan 31-1
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN LEGAL CONSIDERATIONS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 3 Para 3.1-Para 3.3

RFL.question: When may a juvenile be issues a CVB 1805?
RFL.answer: Traffic infractions only
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN LEGAL CONSIDERATIONS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 3 Para 3.1-Para 3.3

RFL.question: Patrols will issue what form to any person who has suffered direct physical, emotional or financial harm as a result of an offense.
RFL.answer: DD Form 2701
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM VICTIM AND WITNESS ASSISTANCE - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 8 Para 8.8

RFL.question: Bomb Threat: Name three of five types of IED's commonly used.
RFL.answer: Pyrotechnic, Electrical, Mechanical, Time Mechanism and Chemical
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

RFL.question: What form is utilized to assist in capturing vital information during a telephone bomb threat?
RFL.answer: AF Form 440, Bomb Threat Aid
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

RFL.question: Bomb Threat: Ensure radio transmissions are not made within _______ (distance) of the affected area.
RFL.answer: 50 feet
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

RFL.question: Bomb Threat: If a detonation time is given, do not search within ______ (time) before or after the detonation time.
RFL.answer: 30 minutes
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

RFL.question: Bomb Threat: An initial evacuation distance of ____________ for items up to box size (large briefcase/package - 2 cubic ft.).
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

RFL.question: Bomb Threat: An initial evacuation distance of _______ for van or small truck.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

RFL.question: Active Shooter - Phase 1
RFL.answer: Neutralize the threat(s)
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ACTIVE SHOOTER RESPONSE - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 13 Para 13.1-Para 13.7.2

RFL.question: Active Shotter - Phase 2
RFL.answer: PHASE II - Secure the immediate area (all threats to include IEDs)
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ACTIVE SHOOTER RESPONSE - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 13 Para 13.1-Para 13.7.2

RFL.question: Active Shooter - Phase 5
RFL.answer: Establish and preserve the crime scene
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ACTIVE SHOOTER RESPONSE - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 13 Para 13.1-Para 13.7.2

RFL.question: Define the term 'Covered Wagon'
RFL.answer: COVERED WAGON reports inform HHQ that an unusual incident affecting PL 1, 2, or 3 resources, probably or actually hostile, occurred at an installation or dispersed site.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM COVERED WAGON PROCEDURES - SFTRG 2v3 Chap 2. Security Reporting and Alerting System

RFL.question: Whom may cancel a Covered Wagon report?
RFL.answer: Installation Commander or designee may cancel the COVERED WAGON incident.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM COVERED WAGON PROCEDURES - SFTRG 2v3 Chap 2. Security Reporting and Alerting System

RFL.question: True or False: SF/DAF CP patrol may assist local authorities as long as they do not engage in enforcement of civil law.
RFL.answer: True
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN MUTUAL AID POLICE RESPONSES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 8 Para 8.14

RFL.question: What actions must you take during a launch mishap?
RFL.answer: Clearing Officers and all others on-duty take immediate cover in assigned vehicle, guard houses or other available shelter. All TCPs must remain hard down unless they feel their life is in danger, at which time they will leave the vehicle barriers in place, proceed to a pre-determined launch shelter, and notify the LOS upon arrival.
RFL.ref: XPLAIN LAUNCH OPERATIONS GENERAL INFORMATION - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 4 Para 4.2.1-4.4.2

RFL.question: What document is utilized to aid in the purge of the FCA/BDA?
RFL.answer: Man-load list
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM LAUNCH CLEARING OFFICER DUTIES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 4 Para 4.1.3-4.1.3.5

RFL.question: Define the term 'Hard Down'
RFL.answer: Ensure no one enters the area unless they are cleared through BDOC, Whiskey Control, and/or the LOS or the SL.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM LAUNCH OPERATIONS POSTED TCP DUTIES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 4 Para 4.1.5-4.1.5.6

RFL.question: The term ______ will be used when an individual deliberately drives past the IEC without being properly vetted.
RFL.answer: gate runner
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM TURN AROUND/GATE RUNNER PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.5-9.5.5.9

RFL.question: The deployment of the Stinger Spike System must be authorized by whom?
RFL.answer: Flight Sergeant
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM TURN AROUND/GATE RUNNER PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.5-9.5.5.9

RFL.question: Civil Disturbances - Describe PHASE THREE: Group Oriented Violence.
RFL.answer: This phase is characterized by roaming assaults on lone individuals and/or fights with opposing groups, or assembly of personnel at base entry points.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM RESPONSE TO CIVIL DISTURBANCES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 1

RFL.question: Civil Disturbances - Describe PHASE FIVE: After-Confrontation Phase.
RFL.answer: This phase is characterized by the cessation of confrontational activities and close out of all administrative and legal actions regarding the disturbance.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM RESPONSE TO CIVIL DISTURBANCES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 1

RFL.question: DoD Installations must provide Safe Haven for AA&E shipments during emergency conditions. What areas are designated for Safe Haven at PSFB and CCSFS?
RFL.answer: PSFB - Hot Cargo Pad (HCP) #1 & CCSFS - MSA #2
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY SAFE HAVEN PROCEDURES - 45 SWI 24-602-O Chap 5.1 Para 5.1.1-5.5.4

RFL.question: During an alarm response, the initial patrol arrives and establishes themselves at 'Point #1' of the facility. Where is he/she located?
RFL.answer: Left of the main entrance.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM RESPONSE - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 4. Chap 5. Chap 6.

RFL.question: Define the term 'Cordon.'
RFL.answer: A cordon surrounds the accident area where controls are established to keep emergency responders safe and preclude unauthorized entry. Cordon sizes vary and will be decided by the IC or be predetermined by local guidance.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM RESPONSE - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 4. Chap 5. Chap 6.

RFL.question: Where should the Access Control Point (ACP) be established along the cordon of a hazardous incident?
RFL.answer: The ACP is established upwind or crosswind of the incident site and at the established evacuation distance.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM RESPONSE - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 4. Chap 5. Chap 6.

RFL.question: Who will assume initial IC (incident Command) for law and order and security related responses.
RFL.answer: The Senior SF Member
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM RESPONSE - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 4. Chap 5. Chap 6.

RFL.question: When conducting a sweep of an alarmed facility when an alarm has been activated and no personnel are on duty, what are patrols looking for?
RFL.answer: Signs of forced entry, out of place objects, etc.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM RESPONSE - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 4. Chap 5. Chap 6.

RFL.question: Who determines the size of an initial cordon?
RFL.answer: Incident Commander
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM RESPONSE - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 4. Chap 5. Chap 6.

RFL.question: Explain when a person charged with driving under the influence may be released?
RFL.answer: Until eight hours have elapsed from the time the person was taken into custody. Until the person's blood-alcohol level or breath-alcohol level is less than 0.05. No longer under the influence of alcoholic beverages or any chemical substance
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM DRUNK/IMPAIRED DRIVING ENFORCEMENT - 45 SF OI 31-1 V3 Chap 8 Para 8.4-8.4.3.4

RFL.question: What documents will be considered when allowing the removal of government property from the installation?
RFL.answer: Bill of Lading, AF IMT 1297, other shipping documents
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM GOVERNMENT PROPERTY AND CARGO CLEARANCE FORMS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.6-9.6.4

RFL.question: Define the CCSFS North Sector
RFL.answer: From Traffic Control Point (TCP) 25N to the east on Phillips Parkway through Complex 34 to the beach, north along the beach to the north boundary, west to incorporate the entire ITL area, the entire Complex 41 area and support buildings, south along ITL road back to TCP 25 N and all areas in between.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN SECURITY FORCE INSTALLATION PATROLLING AND SECTOR PRIORITIZATION - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 3

RFL.question: Define the CCSFS Industrial Sector.
RFL.answer: From TCP 25 N east on Phillips Parkway through Complex 34 to the beach, then south along the beach to Camera Road A, west to Pier Road, then south to TCP 7 along Flight Control Road, (not to include NAVSTAR Processing Complex (NPC) area), to Phillips Parkway to TCP 10, west to the Indian River and all areas in between.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN SECURITY FORCE INSTALLATION PATROLLING AND SECTOR PRIORITIZATION - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 3

RFL.question: Define the CCSFS South Sector.
RFL.answer: North boundary of the South Sector is east from the Banana River to TCP 10 at Phillips Parkway, south to Flight Control Road to the east to TCP 7 (to include the NPC area), north to Camera Road A east to the beach, south along the beach to include the entire Navy Port Area, Pass and ID and Deas Gate, from Deas Gate to the north of the Banana River along the shoreline
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN SECURITY FORCE INSTALLATION PATROLLING AND SECTOR PRIORITIZATION - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 3

RFL.question: Define PSFB Zone A.
RFL.answer: Zone A is from the stone fence perimeter separating north housing and the suburb of Cocoa Beach, south to the Fire Dept., west to the west side of runway 03/21, southwest to the Banana River south of Famcamp, north along the shoreline to the stone fence. This zone includes the Chevron Park, 750 Ramp, DEOMI, and North Housing and is known as the industrial area.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN SECURITY FORCE INSTALLATION PATROLLING AND SECTOR PRIORITIZATION - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 3

RFL.question: Define PSFB Zone B
RFL.answer: Zone B is from the Fire Department south to the stone wall at the corner of A1A and Pineda Causeway, west to the end of the marina, north up the shoreline to the south of Famcamp, northeast to west of runway 03/21, east to the Fire Department. This includes south gate, central housing, Air Force Technical Application Center
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN SECURITY FORCE INSTALLATION PATROLLING AND SECTOR PRIORITIZATION - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 3

RFL.question: Define PSFB Zone C
RFL.answer: Zone C is from the north end of the beach access areas east of the stone fence perimeter separating north housing and the suburb of Cocoa Beach, south to Pineda Beach. This zone also encompasses the Tides Collocated Club and Pelican Coast, south housing area. The Landings at Patrick, which includes the Chapel, Shark Center, Youth Center and ball fields and is bounded by a wall on the north separating the housing area from South Patrick Shores, SR A1A on the east side, the wall on the south side near Satellite High School, and by South Patrick Drive.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN SECURITY FORCE INSTALLATION PATROLLING AND SECTOR PRIORITIZATION - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 3

RFL.question: Define a major traffic accident.
RFL.answer: A major traffic accident is any accident involving a fatality, injury or property damage above the amount established by installation commanders.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM TRAFFIC ACCIDENT INVESTIGATION - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 29

RFL.question: What document is issued to civilian offenders suspected of shoplifting?
RFL.answer: CVB Form 1805
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM LARCENY/SHOPLIFTING PROCEDURES - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 3 Para Response to Shoplifting

RFL.question: Workplace Violence Type 1 is defined as __________
RFL.answer: A violent act by criminals who have no other connection with the workplace, but to commit robbery or another crime.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKPLACE/SCHOOL/CHILD DEVELOPMENT CENTER VIOLENCE RESPONSE - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 10

RFL.question: Workplace Violence Type 3 is defined as __________
RFL.answer: Violence against coworkers, supervisors, or managers by a present or former employee.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKPLACE/SCHOOL/CHILD DEVELOPMENT CENTER VIOLENCE RESPONSE - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 10

RFL.question: Workplace Violence Type 4 is defined as __________
RFL.answer: Violence is committed in the workplace by someone who doesn't work there, but has a personal relationship with an employee, an abusive spouse, or domestic partner.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKPLACE/SCHOOL/CHILD DEVELOPMENT CENTER VIOLENCE RESPONSE - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 10

RFL.question: If a non-military members entering or exiting the installation refuses to consent to a RIEVC, what must you do?
RFL.answer: Advise individual that refusal will result in denial of base access and may result in the loss of base driving privileges and/or debarment action and conduct a walk around inspection for signs of contraband in plain view.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM RANDOM INSTALLATION ENTRY/EXIT VEHICLE CHECKS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 8 Para 8.2-8.2.2.2

RFL.question: If RIEVC consent is not secured and contraband is discovered during a walkaround inspection of a vehicle, what must you do?
RFL.answer: If contraband is found, detain personnel, seize the contraband as evidence, secure the vehicle, and seek search authority.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM RANDOM INSTALLATION ENTRY/EXIT VEHICLE CHECKS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 8 Para 8.2-8.2.2.2

RFL.question: Roadblocks must provide the suspect the opportunity to stop. Roadblocks will not be established where?
RFL.answer: Curves, bridges, or areas where visibility of the roadblock is hindered.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ROADBLOCK PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.5.5.

RFL.question: The Stinger Spike system will only be deployed in areas that afford the deploying officer what?
RFL.answer: a protected position
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM STINGER SPIKE SYSTEM PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.5.4.

RFL.question: Avoid placing the Stinger system near what areas?
RFL.answer: intersections, railroad crossings, pedestrian crossings, or highly populated and unprotected areas such as ball fields, running tracks, etc.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM STINGER SPIKE SYSTEM PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.5.4.

RFL.question: How is the duress activated utilizing a RA card reader?
RFL.answer: When using card readers, adding one number to the Personal Identification Number (PIN) will automatically signal a duress situation to the BDOC.
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

RFL.question: What technique is used to facilitate emergency entry into an SF posted RA?
RFL.answer: Sign/countersign
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

RFL.question: What is the maximum response time to the NAOC when notified by BDOC?
RFL.answer: 10 minutes
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

RFL.question: Explain response time by the ISRT to a PL2 resource?
RFL.answer: 5 minutes
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

RFL.question: What is the maximum response time to a PL-3 resource on CCSFS by an ESRT?
RFL.answer: 15 minutes
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

RFL.question: What is the maximum response time to a PL-3 resource on PSFB by a patrol?
RFL.answer: 10 minutes
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

RFL.question: What is the area designator on the RAB for the 750 Ramp?
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

RFL.question: What is the area designator on the RAB for Skid Strip (when posted)
RFL.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

RFL.question: What Act/Law prevents Air Force personnel from executing the laws of the states or the laws of the U.S. except when acting under the authority of the U.S. Constitution, an Act of Congress or under the direction of the President of the United States.
RFL.answer: The Posse Comitatus Act
RFL.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 51 Posse Comitatus Act

RFL.question: Define the term 'Hearsay.'
RFL.answer: 'Hearsay' is a statement, other than the one made by the declarant while testifying at the trial or hearing, offered in evidence to prove the truth of the matter asserted.
RFL.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 54 RULES OF EVIDENCE.

RFL.question: Define the term 'declarant.'
RFL.answer: A 'declarant' is a person who makes a statement.
RFL.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 54 RULES OF EVIDENCE.

RFL.question: Define the term 'search.'
RFL.answer: A search is an examination of a person, property or premises to uncover evidence of a crime or criminal intent, such as stolen goods, burglary tools and weapons.
RFL.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 54

RFL.question: Define the term 'statement.'
RFL.answer: A 'statement' is (1) an oral or written assertion or (2) nonverbal conduct of a person, if it is intended by the person as an assertion.
RFL.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 54 RULES OF EVIDENCE.

RFL.question: Define the term 'Protective Frisk.'
RFL.answer: A Defender may perform a protective frisk during a lawful stop when the member reasonably believes a person is armed and presently dangerous to the member or others.
RFL.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 54 RULES OF EVIDENCE.

RFL.question: Define the term 'Covered Wagon.'
RFL.answer: COVERED WAGON reports inform HHQ that an unusual incident affecting PL 1, 2, or 3 resources, probably or actually hostile, occurred at an installation or dispersed site.
RFL.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 2 Resource Security, CH2. SECURITY REPORTING AND ALERTING SYSTEM.
